Tereza,

Thanks for your mail!  The tutorial you linked to is definitely on=
 the
shorter side.  However, searching for "JUnit tutorials" does provide a=

number of write-ups of varying lengths and quality.  Before you devote a
l=
ot of time to writing your own, I wonder if you think that perhaps one of
t=
hose would be a good thing to link to as a supplement to what's on the
gith=
ub site?

Thanks,

   David

On Fri, Oct 16, 2015 at 2:26 AM, jana novakova=
 qwiriella@... [junit] <
junit@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

>
>
> Dear Si=
r/Madam,
>
> I am writing to you regarding JUnit tests tutorials. I am curr=
ently
> studying informatics at University of West Bohemia in Pilsen, and w=
hile
> browsing https://github.com/junit-team/junit/wiki/Getting-started I
=
> discovered that very basic instructions on how to start using JUnit tests=

> are quite brief. My supervisor has some tutorials for beginners; however=
,
> they are in Czech - not very useful for the rest of the world. I was
> =
thinking of perharps filling in this gap - I probably would be able to
> pr=
epare a consistent introduction based on materials provided.
> Could it be =
useful for you? If so, I would appreciate some starting tips
> (suitable/re=
commended tools for writing, formating standards etc.)
>
>
> Regards
> Tere=
za S.
>
> 
>

--047d7b3a9bc0b9a32005223a326d

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
